summary: Cell membranes have special properties to help keep in, keep out, and transfer useful materials. The membrane can help maintain the pH in a cell, while restricting the movement of larger molecules like glucose. Topic 2.4 is about what can and cannot freely move through the cell membrane.

vocab.definition: Describes the property of the cell membrane to allow some molecules or ions to pass through while preventing others, maintaining the cellâ€™s internal balance
Lipids which contain a hydrophilic head and hydrophobic tail and make up cell membranes
A rigid or strong outer layer found in plants, fungi, bacteria, algae, and archaea, but not in animal cells, which provides structural support, protection, and shape to the cell
Channels in land plant and algal cell walls that connect the cytoplasm of neighboring cells, allowing for direct transport and communication of molecules like sugars, ions, and proteins
